item.title: Linear Programming in R
item.description: Basic Operations Research Models Iâ€™m going to use the lpSolve package in order to solve 3 basic OR problems. The notation shows the problems in standard form. 1. Allocation In an allocation problem, the amount of resources available to the decision variables is fixed. \[ \sum_{k=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{p}\sum_{i=1}^{m} x_{i,j,k} f_{j} \] coeff <- c(30, 40, 80) 2. Blending Models In a blending model, the amount of resources available to the decision variables is unlimited, but we normally want to minimize cost.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello! My name is Anthony Yoskovich and I am currently a senior at Grand Valley State University. I plan to receive a Bachelor’s of Science in both Statistics and Economics in April of 2020.
